contentrichtext.text: {{BLP sources|date=June 2013}} {{notability|Music|date=June 2013}} '''Oğuz Yılmaz''' (born October 25, 1968) is a [[folk musician]] in [[Turkey]]. He was born and grew up in [[Ankara]], Turkey. He lived and performed most of his life in [[Sincan, Ankara|Sincan]], a region of Ankara. Therefore he is also known as "Oguz from Sincan". His lyrics were controversial, educational and also entertaining. His musical style was a combination of traditional [[Turkish folk music]] with [[modern dance music]]. His major hits include: "''Bas Bas Paralari Leylaya''", "''Ankaranin Koçları''", "''Bartının Güzelleri''", "''Usta''", "''Zalim Gurbet''", "''Misket''", "''Götür''", "''Kaynana''", and "''Gördün mü''". ==External links== *[http://www.oguzyilmaz.com.tr/Ozgecmisim.html Biography and Personal Website] (Turkish) {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Yilmaz, Oguz | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Turkish musician | DATE OF BIRTH = October 25, 1968 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Yilmaz, Oguz}} [[Category:1968 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Musicians from Ankara]] [[Category:Turkish musicians]] {{Turkey-musician-stub}}
